page.title: 18Watershed At Mulben
page.content: When you look at the map of Mulben, you wiil see a burn (small stream) flowing along parallel to the road and the railway line. From the Level Crossing towards Keith, it is known as the Rosarie Burn. It flows toward Keith into the River Isla. From the Level Crossing towards Mulben it is known as the burn of Mulben and it flows to the River Spey. We stood on the bridge by the Level Crossing and watched the water flowing towards Keith. Then we walked in the other direction along a track by the Railway Line and saw the Burn of Mulben flowing in the opposite direction. Our teacher told us that the point from where water flows in different directions is called a Watershed.
